dmTitle.infoName: Default business rules exchange data module

levelledPara.title: Gas Processing Unit (GPU)
levelledPara.para:
The GPU (refer to ) performs three functions: a) the production of product gas in the GGS, b) the disposal of byproduct gas and waste gas in the BMP and c) the operational control over the ILPE. The GGS is a totally enclosed unit. The GGS houses all the components necessary to produce product gas. The major components involved in the production are:
the electrolysis cell stack (CSK-050G)
the water filter (FLT-637G)
the chiller (HX-635G)
the circulation pump (PMP-633G)
the low pressure phase separator (PHS-030G)
the dehumidifier (HX-031G)
the demineralizer bed (DIB-623G)
the resistivity sensor (RS-1611G)
the high pressure phase separator (PHS-138G).

A venturi (VN-636G) and differential pressure transducers (DPT-1617-1G and DPT-1617-2G) provide flow indication. Temperature sensors are located within the piping, in wells, to provide thermal monitoring of the process. Manual valves, flow restrictors, solenoid valves and pressure transducers provide control for the process. These components are housed in manifolds. The manifolds are readily accessible and eliminate the need to disassemble piping connections when maintenance or repair is required. Electrical power distribution is provided by the LIB (LIB-776E).

The BMP houses all the components necessary to perform a chemical conversion process. The primary purpose of the BMP is to perform the chemical conversion process that combines byproduct gas and waste gas resulting in a liquid product. The major components involved in the conversion are:
the collector (PHS275B)
the blower (BLR371B)
the regenerator (HX369B)
condenser (HX368B)
the recycle heater (HTR364B)
the converter (CNV365B)
the degasser (PHS280B).

Fluids required for cooling, gases for processing and the liquid product formed enter or leave at the fluid interfaces. A venturi (VN-370B) and differential pressure transducers (DPT-1335B and DPT-1336B) provide flow indication. Manual valves, flow restrictors, flow control valves, solenoid valves and pressure transducers are housed in manifolds. These manifolds are readily accessible and eliminate the need to disassemble piping connections when maintenance or repair is required.

A bus based controller provides the operational control of the ILPE. The process controller includes:
a microprocessor board (CPM-770E)
memory and input/output (I/O) boards
an independent shutdown monitor board (ISM-774E)
the Electrolysis Power Supply (EPS) (EPS-777E)
a logic power supply (LPS-775E).

The process controller controls:
start-up
operation
self-health monitoring
contingency mode operation
fault identification
troubleshooting
